Description: Nearly complete North Ionian pottery rosette bowl, reconstructed from many fragments, some parts missing, including part of one handle; exterior: three brown bands on mid wall; above, three large dot rosettes on each side; interior: glazed black with one band in added red lined in white; in reserved tondo five-pointed star with solid rays; handles black; black band around the edge of the top of the foot; underside of foot reserved, with tree-shaped graffito.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.824.1)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.52)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
